Function Documentation

int rbxNexusConnection_connect (  int  nexusHandle  ) 
 

Attempts to connect to a remote Nexus application.

If this method fails and returns an error, the NexusConnection will not automatically retry the connection.

Parameters:
[in] nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection
Returns:
RBX_E_UNKNOWN_HOST if the specified host cannot be found
RBX_E_IO_ERROR if an IO error occurs when connecting to the host (commonly occurs when host is found but remote Nexus application is not found)
RBX_E_UNSUPPORTED_VERSION if a remote Nexus was found, but it is incompatible
RBX_E_ILLEGAL_STATE if NexusConnection is in the process of connecting
RBX_E_NEXUS_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified NexusConnection handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexusConnection_disconnect (  int  nexusHandle  ) 
 

Disconnects from the remote Nexus application.

Parameters:
[in] nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection
Returns:
RBX_E_NEXUS_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified NexusConnection handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexusConnection_getUsborCount (  int  nexusHandle,
int *  count
) 
 

Gets the number of Usbor devices contained in the Nexus.

Parameters:
[in] nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection
[out] count pointer to an int that receives the Usbor count
Returns:
RBX_E_NEXUS_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified NexusConnection handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexusConnection_getUsborByIndex (  int  nexusHandle,
int  index,
int *  usborHandle
) 
 

Gets a handle to the Usbor at the specified index in the Usbor list.

Note that an Usbor's index may change at any time due to other Usbors being added/removed.

This method, in conjunction with rbxNexusConnection_getUsborListMod(), can be used to iterate through all existing Usbors.

Parameters:
[in] nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection
[in] index the Usbor index (zero-based)
[out] usborHandle pointer to an int that receives the Usbor handle;
receives zero if the Usbor was not found
Returns:
RBX_E_NEXUS_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified NexusConnection handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexusConnection_getUsborByName (  int  nexusHandle,
const char *  usborName,
int *  usborHandle
) 
 

Gets the Usbor with the specified name.

Parameters:
[in] nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection
[in] usborName the name of the Usbor to search for
[out] usborHandle pointer to an int that receives the Usbor handle;
receives zero if the Usbor was not found
Returns:
RBX_E_NEXUS_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified NexusConnection handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexusConnection_getUsborBySerial (  int  nexusHandle,
const char *  serialNum,
int *  usborHandle
) 
 

Gets the Usbor with the specified serial number.

Parameters:
[in] nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection
[in] serialNum the serial number of the Usbor to search for
[out] usborHandle pointer to an int that receives the Usbor handle;
receives zero if the Usbor was not found
Returns:
RBX_E_NEXUS_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified NexusConnection handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexusConnection_getUsborListMod (  int  nexusHandle,
int *  mod
) 
 

Gets the modification number for the NexusConnections's Usbor list.

This number is incremented every time a new Usbor is detected or an existing Usbor is removed.

This function is typically used to determine if any new Usbors have appeared or any existing Usbors have disappeared.

Parameters:
[in] nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection
[out] mod pointer to an int that receives the mod
Returns:
RBX_E_NEXUS_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified NexusConnection handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxNexusConnection_getRepName (  int  nexusHandle,
char *  repName,
int  maxLen,
int *  retLen
) 
 

Gets the name of the peer object (the Rep) to which a NexusConnection is connected.

Parameters:
[in] nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection
[out] repName pointer to a user buffer that receives the string; or NULL to get the required buffer length
[in] maxLen length of user buffer
[out] retLen pointer to an int that receives the actual number of characters copied or the required buffer length (if user buffer is NULL);
this paramater can be NULL only if the user buffer is not NULL;
Returns:
RBX_E_NEXUS_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified NexusConnection handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
Fetching Strings

int rbxNexusConnection_getRepLocation (  int  nexusHandle,
char *  repLoc,
int  maxLen,
int *  retLen
) 
 

Gets the location of the NexusConnection's peer, e.g.

"127.0.0.1".

Parameters:
[in] nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection
[out] repLoc pointer to a user buffer that receives the string; or NULL to get the required buffer length
[in] maxLen length of user buffer
[out] retLen pointer to an int that receives the actual number of characters copied or the required buffer length (if user buffer is NULL);
this paramater can be NULL only if the user buffer is not NULL;
Returns:
RBX_E_NEXUS_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified NexusConnection handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
Fetching Strings

int rbxNexusConnection_getRepResponseTimeMs (  int  nexusHandle,
int *  timeMs
) 
 

Gets the average reponse time (aka ping time) of the Nexus's peer.

This is the amount of time it takes a message to make a round trip, to the peer and back again.

Parameters:
[in] nexusHandle a handle to the NexusConnection
[out] timeMs pointer to an int that receives the average response time (in milliseconds)
Returns:
RBX_E_NEXUS_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified NexusConnection handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
